intro: Epinetrum glabrum, commonly known as the smooth epine. It is a flowering plant native to South Africa, belonging to the Asteraceae family. The plant is characterized by its narrow, grass-like leaves and small, yellowish flowers that bloom in clusters. It typically grows in sandy or gravelly soils and is often found in open, sunny habitats. Epinetrum glabrum is adapted to arid conditions and is relatively drought-tolerant.
